NAME: Name
TUTORIAL_SLIDE0_DESCRIPTION: I'm a technological advanced personal assistant, backed by artificial inteligence, to help you know yourself, live better and be happier
TUTORIAL_SLIDE02_DESCRIPTION: I was built around time-tested principles for conducting a wise, balanced and good life; borrowing from many thinkers from Epictetus 100 AD to Stephen Covey. I am a computer-based life-system that will help you thrive, enjoy more and even lead and help others
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_TITLE: Becoming the best of you is not about goals or tasks
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_DESCRIPTION: I want to help you becoming the best of you, using your time on earth as wise as possible. But we should not care too much about arbitrary artificial goals or predefined tasks. Every day, we will re-assess and ask ourselves. How can I use this day, or week, or year to the fullest according to my interests?
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_TITLE: Your wishes on our system for you
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_DESCRIPTION: In the next few slides, I will summarize our system through a series of steps to define and organize your life for the better. Enjoy and relax, we will guide you by proposing a very practical approach, with very concrete ideas and a rapid setup to reboot your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_TITLE: Step 1. Identify everything you care in your life.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_DESCRIPTION: We are going to consider everything. Everything you care. To do that I will start by proposing you the areas that most humans like you care about: health, family, your mind, money, friends, work, etc. and then we will add some specific ones for you. It will take some time, that is ok, it's your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_TITLE: Everything is connected but life needs focus
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_DESCRIPTION: To think or to act we need to focus on specifics. That is the pourpose of a 'Lucket', a specific isolated 'life bucket' that represents a permanent life subject that you plan to care and improve over time. I will track and analyze wishes, status and actions in your Luckets to help you become better
TUTORIAL_SLIDE111_DESCRIPTION: When step 1 is done, you will have one lucket for anything you care. Now, you can forget about stuff outside your luckets.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_TITLE: Step 2. Order the luckets to represent the priorities in your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_DESCRIPTION: All luckets are important but some will be more important to you when things go wrong. There a many ways to define priorities, sometimes is obvious, sometimes is a personal choice. I will propose you some initial order and then we will fine tune it to you
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_TITLE: Step 3. Assess the status of every lucket in your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_DESCRIPTION: Use this color code: Blue is perfection, stop. Green is pretty good. Yellow is warning, do something. Red is really bad, do something asap. White is skip or neglect, maybe is ok. Black is tragic, stop everything and do this.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you want to assess the status of your 'Health' lucket. If you feel fit, flexible, thin and nice but you still need to watch out your diet and your gym, put a green. Good job. If you are 5kg overweight, feel tired and having not going to gym recently put a yellow. If you are 20kgs overweight, have knee pain and cannot stop eating ice cream and smoking for breakfast, put a red. I would not use white here, your call, but neglecting your health is a bad strategy. I hope you never put black in this lucket. That is very sad, but may happen, specially is you do not stop that smoking. If you feel like the Dalai Lama going to the Olympics put a blue.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2b_TITLE: Step 3. Assess the status of every lucket in your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2b_DESCRIPTION: Blue is perfection and you should stop. Green is pretty good but keep working. Yellow is warning, do something eventually . Red is pretty bad, please do something asap. White is neglect or skip. You decide not to care about this lucket. Black is tragic. You need to stop everything else with lower priority and take care of this lucket alone.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you want to assess the status of your 'Health' lucket. If you feel fit, flexible, thin and nice but you still need to watch out your diet and your gym, put a green. Good job. If you are 5kg overweight, feel tired and having not going to gym recently put a yellow. If you are 20kgs overweight, have knee pain and cannot stop eating ice cream and smoking for breakfast, put a red. I would not use white here, your call, but neglecting your health is a bad strategy. I hope you never put black in this lucket. That is very sad, but may happen, specially is you do not stop that smoking. If you feel like the Dalai Lama going to the Olympics put a blue.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_TITLE: Step 4. Define activities for the week, season and year
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_DESCRIPTION: Life is about doing things we care within time frames. Humans living on earth work better using time frames based on the sun and the moon. The week is the best unit of planning, even earth was created in one. Some activities need a longer term, a season or a year
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_TITLE: Step 5. Day by day, pick from your week list
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_DESCRIPTION: We will always try, but is hard to perfectly plan a day. Some meetings will be fixed, but the rest should be adaptative. Together, we will intelligently assess our day circumstances and decide what is the best to do from your bucket lists. Carpe diem.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_TITLE: Step 6. Day by day, assess your achievements within time frames
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_DESCRIPTION: Similar to circles for lucket status, we use colored squares to show the status of activities within their time frame. The meaning is somehow similar. Blue means 'done', green 'in progress', etc
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_TITLE: Step 7. Tell me how much you love that lucket
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_DESCRIPTION: Not all luckets are the same when it comes to deal with them. Some thing we care stress us a lot, some of them relax us, some are in the middle. Use color coded triagles to tell me how you feel about it. Blue means love, read means hate
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_TITLE: Step 8. Tell me how you feel
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_DESCRIPTION: Humans are cute but complicated. You have feelingsand that greatly impact plans. For every lucket assess: general mood, feeling about circumstances, motivation, energy, focus. social need. Again, we will use a similar color code for this
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5b_DESCRIPTION: This system is not about taking hard decisions and stick to them for a long time. Is about ccontinously re-assesing, thinking, recalculating what is the best. Periodically, every week, or every day, we will re-asses your luckets and adapt to optimize our plan
TUTORIAL_SLIDE6_TITLE: Step 10. Check my reports and advice
TUTORIAL_SLIDE6_DESCRIPTION: Based on the historical data I will be collecting about your luckets, activities, feelings and information about your circunstances I will be continously giving you new advice, new ways to improve. We will be a team.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE_LAST_TITLE: Good job. Now, please, slow down and relax. Press continue when your are ready, maybe tomorrow. Cheers.
